info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 13 at 8:22PM PDT until October 13 at 11:15PM PDT by NWS San Francisco CA
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of central California, including the following county, northwestern Monterey.
* WHEN...Until 1115 PM PDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 822 PM PDT, local law enforcement reported heavy rain in N. Freemont Street. Minor flooding is already occurring. Up to 1 inch of rain has fallen. - N. Freemont Street is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Seaside, Monterey, Marina, Del Rey Oaks and Sand City. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 PM PDT THIS EVENING
